byline.original: By ASHLEY SOUTHALL and NATE SCHWEBER

lead_paragraph: Initial reports said that Dayshen McKenzie died in May after being chased by a group of youths yelling a racial slur, but the police said the episode was a gang altercation.

headline.print_headline: Black Teenager’s Death Does Not Appear to Be Hate Crime, Police Say
headline.main: Black Teenager’s Death on Staten Island Does Not Appear to Be a Hate Crime, the Police Say

snippet: Initial reports said that Dayshen McKenzie died in May after being chased by a group of youths yelling a racial slur, but the police said the episode was a gang altercation.
abstract: New York Police Dept official announces that teenager Dayshen McKenzie, whose death on Staten Island drew calls for federal hate crime investigation, died as result of asthma attack and was not victim of racial bias; McKenzie, who is black, collapsed while running with mob of youths in what investigation has shown was preplanned fight in Mariners Harbor neighborhood between rival street gangs.
